Drew,
Thank you for your e-mails and your help.

sincerely
Adele


________=
________________________
 From: Drew Kirkpatrick <drew.kirkpatrick@...=
m>
To: neat@yahoogroups.com 
Sent: Wednesday, December 7, 2011 5:41 PM
Subj=
ect: Re: [neat] NEAT for beginners
 
Adele,

Sorry for the confusion, I tho=
ught you were trying to find=A0more C++
NEAT examples. I'm afraid I'm a low=
ly C/C++ coder, and don't know
anything really about C#. I believe the Shar=
pNEAT C# version is one of
the more polished NEAT libraries.

There's a 3 p=
art tutorial using the C# version starting here that might help:
http://www=
.nashcoding.com/2010/07/17/tutorial-evolving-neural-networks-with-sharpneat=
-2-part-1/

That might help a bit. If you have problems with going through =
the C#
code, the python version might help. From what I understand, python =
is
a very intuitive language. I'm not sure if they've released any code
yet=
. There's also the Java version.

Sorry I wasn't more help. Good luck!

-Dr=
ew

On Wed, Dec 7, 2011 at 2:44 AM, adeleh ebrahimi <adlh_ebrahimi@...=
m> wrote:
>
>
>
> Drew,
> Thank you!
>
> I chose Mr. Bookland book just bec=
ause of its easy and simple codes, but I am working in the area of =A0"Game=
s", and I think Bookland implementation is =A0not a proper choice.
> =A0I w=
ant to implement my project with =A0a Visual Programming language, maybe "C=
#"!, but As I said I do not have enough experience in C# and I could not un=
derstand some of C# codes of NEAT implementation. So I need a simple exampl=
e.
>
> Adele
>
> ________________________________
> From: Drew Kirkpatrick =
<drew.kirkpatrick@...>
> To: neat@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Tuesday, De=
cember 6, 2011 6:22 PM
> Subject: Re: [neat] NEAT for beginners
>
>
> Adele=
,
>
> I also started off from Mat Buckland's book, and have been working wi=
th a modified version of his implementation. If you're particular about sti=
cking with his implementation and C++ (his is a relatively simple implement=
ation of NEAT from what I understand) I can send you my code if you want (b=
uggy work in progress).
>
> It's not a simple example at all (competitive c=
oevolution), but it would give you some code examples and bug fixes to Mat =
Buckland's original implementation (mine is a Linux port). Probably only us=
eful to you for looking at the changes I made to Mr. Buckland's code, but t=
hat would be easy as most of the code is the same, and the classes retained=
 their names from those described in his book.
>
> You might want to start =
with getting his minesweeper (was that it?) example application running, an=
d try putting in some of the bug fixes folks have recommended in his implem=
entation (I think I can help find those). Once you have that working, you m=
ight want to try the XOR test, and perhaps pole balancing. I believe those =
are common tasks to undertake.
>
> Let me know if you want any code, or hav=
e any questions I might be able to help with. I'm afraid I'm far from a NEA=
T guru, but I don't think too many folks are working with Mat Buckland's im=
plementation now. I think that's a great book, and that chapter helped me c=
onsiderably in getting started working with NEAT.
>
>
> -Drew
>
> On Tue, D=
ec 6, 2011 at 2:01 AM, adeleh ebrahimi <adlh_ebrahimi@...> wrote:
>
>=

> Hi everybody
> I am new in learning NEAT. I studied Mr. Stanley paper, =
=A0titled "evolving Neural Networks through Augmenting Topologies" and
> No=
w, I am studying last chapter of Mr. Buckland book - "AI techniques for Gam=
e Programming".
>
> But I need to know more about NEAT implementation with =
an example. Is it possible to introduce me a proper and simple example with=
 its tutorial. Unfortunately I don`t have enough experience in C#.
>
> Sinc=
erely
> Adele
>
>
>
>
>
